page.title: 16AMBLE 1885-1985
page.content: In{1885}more{prehistoric discoveries were made from{the Bronze Age.}In{1894 {Amble Urban District Council}replaced the{Local Board convened in 1878.}The {U.D.C. existed until 1974}when under {local government reorganisation}the town gained a{Town Council.}The {population}was{4,428}in{1901:}by{1981 it had risen to{5,317.}In{1917}a {shipyard}commenced on{the Braid}which existed to 1926.{Electricity}was switched on in 1923.{1930}saw the{last {regular train service. Collieries}were {beginning to close -}Newborough (1928) and Broomhill (1968) - but{Radcliffe began to re-operate (1926 - closed in 1968).{1966 planning permission}was given for{an industrial estate.}The {staithes were removed}after{the last {shipment in 1969.}Two years later the {people of Radcliffe}were{rehoused}in Amble and the{railway bridges removed.
